intro: Pedicularis cyrtorhyncha, commonly known as the narrow-lobed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and showy, pink or reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, often with a glandular surface. Pedicularis cyrtorhyncha is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
